leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 计算科学方法论与数值计算生态
leaf_cluster.typical_objects: 稀疏矩阵/算子, 网格与离散系统, PDE/ODE, 误差/收敛数据
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 离散化→求解→误差/稳定性→加速→验证→可复现
leaf_cluster.tool_form: 数值库/求解器框架 + 自动微分/可微分计算 + HPC

unit.unit_name: 谱方法与高阶方法（Galerkin/谱元/高阶FEM）
unit.coverage_tools: 谱/谱元库、基函数、误差估计、高阶装配与求解

tools.name: EDGE
tools.one_line_profile: Extreme-scale Discontinuous Galerkin Environment for seismic and CFD simulations
tools.detailed_description: EDGE is a solver for hyperbolic partial differential equations, focusing on seismic wave propagation and computational fluid dynamics. It utilizes the Discontinuous Galerkin method and is optimized for extreme-scale high-performance computing environments.

tools.name: GalerkinSparseGrids.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Sparse Grid Discretization with Discontinuous Galerkin Method
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package implementing sparse grid discretization combined with the Discontinuous Galerkin method for solving partial differential equations, aiming to mitigate the curse of dimensionality in high-dimensional problems.

tools.name: hexed
tools.one_line_profile: Discontinuous Galerkin CFD solver with automated meshing
tools.detailed_description: A computational fluid dynamics solver based on the discontinuous Galerkin method. It features automated, unstructured quadrilateral/hexahedral meshing capabilities to streamline the simulation workflow.

tools.name: coral
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel spectral solver for PDEs in plane layer geometry
tools.detailed_description: A Fortran-based parallel spectral solver designed for solving partial differential equations in plane layer geometries, suitable for fluid dynamics and other physics simulations requiring high-accuracy spectral discretizations.

tools.name: Dedalus
tools.one_line_profile: Flexible framework for solving PDEs with modern spectral methods
tools.detailed_description: A general-purpose framework for solving partial differential equations using spectral methods. It supports a wide range of equations and domains, automatically handling parallelization and spectral discretization.

tools.name: Eigentools
tools.one_line_profile: Eigenvalue problem analysis package for Dedalus
tools.detailed_description: An extension package for the Dedalus framework specifically designed to solve and analyze eigenvalue problems, facilitating stability analysis and modal decomposition in fluid dynamics and other fields.

tools.name: pySEMTools
tools.one_line_profile: Post-processing package for Spectral Element Method data
tools.detailed_description: A Python package designed for post-processing and analyzing data generated by Spectral Element Method (SEM) simulations, likely supporting formats from solvers like Nek5000.

tools.name: BoSSS
tools.one_line_profile: Flexible Discontinuous Galerkin framework for numerical discretization
tools.detailed_description: A C# framework for the development and application of Discontinuous Galerkin (DG) schemes. It provides infrastructure for solving PDEs with high-order accuracy and flexibility in mesh handling.

tools.name: Basix
tools.one_line_profile: Finite element basis evaluation library for FEniCSx
tools.detailed_description: A library that provides evaluation of finite element basis functions. It is a core component of the FEniCSx project, handling the tabulation of elements for various cell types and polynomial orders.

tools.name: SELF
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral Element Library in Fortran
tools.detailed_description: A Fortran library implementing the Spectral Element Method for solving conservation laws. It is designed for high-performance computing and supports GPU acceleration for fluid dynamics and other physics.

tools.name: SpectralLDA-TensorSpark
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral learning method for LDA topic models on Spark
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of spectral methods (third-order tensor decomposition) for learning Latent Dirichlet Allocation (LDA) topic models, scaled using Apache Spark. It applies spectral algorithms to large-scale data analysis.

tools.name: Quail
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight Discontinuous Galerkin solver for prototyping
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based Discontinuous Galerkin (DG) solver designed for teaching, prototyping, and testing new numerical schemes. It provides a flexible environment for experimenting with DG methods.

tools.name: FastTransforms.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Orthogonal polynomial transforms library for Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for performing fast orthogonal polynomial transforms. It supports various polynomial bases (Chebyshev, Legendre, etc.) and is essential for spectral methods and approximation theory.

tools.name: Adaptive Multiresolution DG
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive multiresolution Discontinuous Galerkin package
tools.detailed_description: A C++ package implementing adaptive multiresolution techniques for the Discontinuous Galerkin method, enabling efficient high-order simulations with local mesh refinement.

tools.name: KTH_Framework
tools.one_line_profile: Toolbox framework for Nek5000
tools.detailed_description: A framework for managing and integrating various toolboxes and extensions developed for the Nek5000 spectral element solver, facilitating workflow management and code reuse within the KTH-Nek5000 ecosystem.

tools.name: FastTransforms
tools.one_line_profile: C library for fast orthogonal polynomial transforms
tools.detailed_description: A C library providing fast algorithms for orthogonal polynomial transforms, serving as a backend for high-performance spectral methods and approximation tasks.

tools.name: Nek5000
tools.one_line_profile: High-fidelity spectral element CFD solver
tools.detailed_description: A highly scalable computational fluid dynamics solver based on the spectral element method. It is designed for high-fidelity simulation of turbulent flows and supports massive parallelism on supercomputers.

tools.name: NekROM
tools.one_line_profile: Model-Order Reduction Framework for Nek5000
tools.detailed_description: A framework integrated with Nek5000 for performing Model-Order Reduction (ROM). It allows for the creation of reduced-order models from high-fidelity spectral element simulations to accelerate analysis and control tasks.

tools.name: NekCEM
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral-element solver for Maxwell's and drift-diffusion equations
tools.detailed_description: A spectral element solver specialized for computational electromagnetics (Maxwell's equations) and drift-diffusion equations. It leverages the high-order accuracy of spectral methods for electromagnetic simulations.

tools.name: hp3d
tools.one_line_profile: hp-adaptive 3D finite element software
tools.detailed_description: A 3D finite element software package supporting hp-adaptivity (simultaneous mesh refinement and polynomial order increase). It is designed for high-accuracy simulations requiring dynamic resolution adjustment.

tools.name: OpenIFEM
tools.one_line_profile: Immersed Finite Element Method implementation based on deal.II
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the Immersed Finite Element Method (IFEM) built upon the deal.II finite element library, designed for solving fluid-structure interaction or interface problems.

tools.name: OpenSEMBA/dgtd
tools.one_line_profile: Discontinuous Galerkin Time Domain solver for Maxwell's equations
tools.detailed_description: A solver for Maxwell's curl equations utilizing discontinuous Galerkin methods (DGTD), suitable for computational electromagnetics simulations.

tools.name: BasisMatrices.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia library for constructing functional basis matrices
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package providing routines to construct BasisMatrices of various types including Chebyshev polynomials, B-Splines, and Smolyak grids, useful for spectral methods and function approximation.

tools.name: ChebyshevApprox.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Multivariate function approximation using Chebyshev polynomials
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package designed to approximate multivariate continuous functions using Chebyshev polynomials, supporting spectral approximation tasks.

tools.name: SPECFEM3D_GEOTECH
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral-element software for 3D geotechnical analysis
tools.detailed_description: An open-source software package for 3D slope stability analysis and simulation of multistage excavation using the spectral-element method (SEM).

tools.name: ChebyKAN
tools.one_line_profile: Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks implementation using Chebyshev polynomials
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks (KAN) that utilizes Chebyshev polynomials as basis functions instead of B-splines, offering a spectral approach to neural network function approximation.

tools.name: pySED
tools.one_line_profile: Phonon spectral energy density calculation tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool to implement the phonon Spectral Energy Density (SED) method for calculating phonon lifetimes and thermal properties in materials science.

tools.name: NekIBM
tools.one_line_profile: Immersed Boundary Method platform based on Nek5000
tools.detailed_description: A multiphase flow simulation platform implementing the Direct-forced Immersed Boundary Method (IBM) on top of the spectral element solver Nek5000.

tools.name: apollo
tools.one_line_profile: MOOSE-based application for 3D electromagnetics simulation
tools.detailed_description: An application enabling 3D electromagnetics simulation within the MOOSE framework, leveraging the MFEM finite element library for underlying computations.

tools.name: Palace
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance 3D computational electromagnetics solver
tools.detailed_description: A parallel, high-performance 3D finite element solver for computational electromagnetics, developed at AWS Labs, supporting large-scale simulations.

tools.name: Chebfun
tools.one_line_profile: Numerical computing with functions in MATLAB
tools.detailed_description: An open-source software system for numerical computing with functions, using Chebyshev polynomials and spectral methods to perform operations like differentiation, integration, and root-finding with high accuracy.

tools.name: chebpy
tools.one_line_profile: Python implementation of Chebfun
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the Chebfun project, enabling numerical computing with functions using Chebyshev polynomial expansions in a Python environment.

tools.name: ryujin
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance high-order finite element solver for hyperbolic conservation equations
tools.detailed_description: Ryujin is a high-performance, high-order finite element solver specifically designed for hyperbolic conservation equations. It leverages convex limiting techniques to ensure stability and accuracy in numerical simulations.

tools.name: dflo
tools.one_line_profile: Discontinuous Galerkin solver for compressible flows
tools.detailed_description: dflo is a C++ based Discontinuous Galerkin (DG) solver designed for simulating compressible fluid flows. It provides a high-order numerical framework for computational fluid dynamics.

tools.name: ultraSEM
tools.one_line_profile: The ultraspherical spectral element method library
tools.detailed_description: ultraSEM is a MATLAB library implementing the ultraspherical spectral element method. It is designed for solving partial differential equations with high accuracy using spectral elements.

tools.name: Spectral_li-ion_SPM
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral numerical solver for Lithium-ion battery Single Particle Model
tools.detailed_description: This tool provides a MATLAB implementation for solving the Single Particle Model (SPM) of lithium-ion batteries using spectral numerical methods, enabling efficient simulation of battery dynamics.

tools.name: deal.II
tools.one_line_profile: A C++ software library supporting the creation of finite element codes
tools.detailed_description: deal.II is a C++ program library targeted at the computational solution of partial differential equations using adaptive finite elements. It uses state-of-the-art programming techniques to offer you a modern interface to the complex data structures and algorithms required.

tools.name: dedalus-sdk-python
tools.one_line_profile: Official Python SDK for the Dedalus spectral method framework
tools.detailed_description: This is the official Python SDK for Dedalus, a flexible framework for solving partial differential equations using spectral methods. It allows users to define and solve PDEs with high accuracy and performance.

tools.name: dedalus-sdk-typescript
tools.one_line_profile: Official TypeScript SDK for the Dedalus API
tools.detailed_description: The TypeScript SDK for Dedalus enables integration of the Dedalus spectral solver framework into web-based applications or TypeScript environments, facilitating remote simulation control or data interaction.

tools.name: PyTorch-Spectral-clustering
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral clustering and dimensionality reduction in PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch implementation of various spectral clustering and dimensionality reduction methods. It leverages GPU acceleration for efficient processing of large datasets in scientific data analysis.

tools.name: PHiLiP
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel High-Order Library for PDEs through hp-adaptive DG methods
tools.detailed_description: PHiLiP is a C++ library for solving partial differential equations using hp-adaptive Discontinuous Galerkin methods. It is designed for high performance and parallel scalability.

tools.name: NebulaSEM
tools.one_line_profile: Finite Volume and high-order Discontinuous Galerkin solver
tools.detailed_description: NebulaSEM is a solver that implements both Finite Volume (FV) and high-order Discontinuous Galerkin (DG) methods for computational fluid dynamics and other conservation laws.

tools.name: pymech
tools.one_line_profile: Python software suite for Nek5000 and SIMSON
tools.detailed_description: pymech is a Python library designed to assist with the pre- and post-processing of data for the Nek5000 (spectral element) and SIMSON (spectral) CFD codes. It provides tools for reading, writing, and manipulating field files.

tools.name: ENRICO
tools.one_line_profile: Exascale Nuclear Reactor Investigative COde
tools.detailed_description: ENRICO is a high-performance simulation code designed for nuclear reactor investigation at the exascale. It likely couples Monte Carlo transport with thermal-hydraulics or other physics.

tools.name: ExaDG
tools.one_line_profile: High-Order Discontinuous Galerkin solver for Exa-Scale
tools.detailed_description: ExaDG is a high-order Discontinuous Galerkin (DG) solver framework designed for exascale computing systems. It focuses on scalability and performance for solving complex PDEs.

tools.name: Exasim
tools.one_line_profile: Generating Discontinuous Galerkin Codes For Extreme Scalable Simulations
tools.detailed_description: Exasim is a tool for generating high-performance Discontinuous Galerkin codes. It automates the creation of solvers for scalable simulations, focusing on GPU acceleration and modern hardware.

tools.name: BinauralSDM
tools.one_line_profile: Tools to render Binaural Room Impulse Responses using Spatial Decomposition Method
tools.detailed_description: BinauralSDM is a set of tools for rendering Binaural Room Impulse Responses (BRIR) using the Spatial Decomposition Method (SDM). It includes improvements for direction of arrival estimation and spectral properties of rendered audio.

tools.name: Feel++
tools.one_line_profile: Finite Element Embedded Language and Library in C++
tools.detailed_description: Feel++ is a C++ library for solving partial differential equations using the finite element method. It provides a domain-specific language embedded in C++ to express variational formulations and solve complex physics problems.

tools.name: FLEXI
tools.one_line_profile: High order discontinuous Galerkin framework for hyperbolic-parabolic conservation laws
tools.detailed_description: FLEXI is a high-order Discontinuous Galerkin (DG) framework designed for solving hyperbolic-parabolic conservation laws. It is optimized for high-performance computing and supports complex geometries.

tools.name: GALÆXI
tools.one_line_profile: High order discontinuous Galerkin framework for compressible flows on GPU systems
tools.detailed_description: GALÆXI is the GPU-accelerated counterpart or extension of the FLEXI framework, providing high-order Discontinuous Galerkin solvers for compressible flows specifically optimized for GPU architectures.

tools.name: AxiSEM
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel spectral-element method for 3D wave propagation in axisymmetric media
tools.detailed_description: AxiSEM is a parallel spectral-element method solver for 3D wave propagation in a sphere with axisymmetric or spherically symmetric structures. It is widely used in global seismology.

tools.name: sparselizard
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance C++ finite element library with hp-adaptivity for multi-physics
tools.detailed_description: A fast, user-friendly, and multiphysics C++ finite element library that supports hp-adaptivity (high-order elements) and is designed for high-performance computing applications.

tools.name: spherical-PDE-solver
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral method solver for PDEs on spherical surfaces
tools.detailed_description: A numerical program designed to solve partial differential equations on a spherical surface using spectral methods based on spherical harmonics.

tools.name: HORSES2D
tools.one_line_profile: High-order spectral element fluid dynamics solver
tools.detailed_description: A two-dimensional high-order spectral element method (SEM) solver designed for fluid dynamics simulations, focusing on accuracy and efficiency.

tools.name: hermes-legacy
tools.one_line_profile: C++ library for hp-adaptive finite element methods
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library implementing hp-FEM (adaptive finite element methods with variable element size and polynomial degree) for solving partial differential equations.

tools.name: marlin
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral solver capability for the MOOSE simulation framework
tools.detailed_description: A code that adds spectral solver capabilities to the MOOSE ecosystem, operating on regular orthogonal grids and supporting GPU acceleration for representative volume elements.

tools.name: grudge
tools.one_line_profile: Discontinuous Galerkin (DG) discretization environment
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based environment for Discontinuous Galerkin methods, part of the 'inducer' scientific computing ecosystem (UIUC), serving as a successor to 'hedge'.

tools.name: hedge
tools.one_line_profile: Hybrid Discontinuous Galerkin environment
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for Discontinuous Galerkin methods, focusing on ease of use and hybrid approaches for solving PDEs.

tools.name: NodesAndModes.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia library for high-order finite element nodes and modes
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package providing nodes and modes (basis functions) for high-order finite element methods, supporting various element shapes and nodal distributions.

tools.name: high-order-layers-torch
tools.one_line_profile: High-order polynomial layers for PyTorch neural networks
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch library implementing high-order and sparse layers using Lagrange polynomials, Chebyshev nodes, and Fourier series, enabling spectral methods within deep learning models.

tools.name: AssociatedLegendrePolynomials.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Fast calculation of Associated Legendre polynomials in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library dedicated to the efficient calculation of Associated Legendre polynomials, which are fundamental basis functions for spectral methods on spheres.

tools.name: SEM2DPACK
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral Element Method for 2D wave propagation and fracture dynamics
tools.detailed_description: A spectral element method (SEM) solver specifically designed for 2D wave propagation and fracture dynamics, widely used in computational seismology and earthquake source dynamics.

tools.name: semlab
tools.one_line_profile: MATLAB-based Spectral Element Method for wave propagation
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB toolbox implementing the Spectral Element Method for simulating wave propagation and rupture dynamics, suitable for educational and research prototyping.

tools.name: mesh_segmentation
tools.one_line_profile: Blender addon for mesh segmentation using spectral clustering
tools.detailed_description: A Python addon for Blender that performs mesh segmentation using spectral clustering methods, enabling scientific visualization and processing of 3D mesh data.

tools.name: FLife
tools.one_line_profile: Vibration fatigue analysis using spectral methods
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for estimating fatigue life from vibration data using spectral methods (frequency domain analysis), supporting various stress-life models.

tools.name: NDG-FEM
tools.one_line_profile: Nodal Discontinuous Galerkin Finite Element Methods solver
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB-based solver implementing Nodal Discontinuous Galerkin Finite Element Methods (NDG-FEM) for various hydraulic and fluid dynamics problems.

tools.name: NSC
tools.one_line_profile: Nyström-based spectral clustering for LiDAR tree segmentation
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of Nyström-based spectral clustering with K-nearest neighbour-based sampling, specifically designed for individual tree segmentation from airborne LiDAR point cloud data.

tools.name: ExaConstit
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated crystal plasticity finite element method (FEM) code
tools.detailed_description: A crystal plasticity finite element method (FEM) code designed to run on GPUs, developed by Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory for materials science simulations.

tools.name: scaleupROM
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable Reduced Order Model with Discontinuous Galerkin Domain Decomposition
tools.detailed_description: A scalable Reduced Order Model (ROM) implementation utilizing Discontinuous Galerkin (DG) Domain Decomposition, developed by LLNL for efficient large-scale simulations.

tools.name: RCS-DGTD
tools.one_line_profile: Radar Cross Section simulation using Discontinuous Galerkin Time Domain methods
tools.detailed_description: MATLAB routines for calculating Radar Cross Section (RCS) using Discontinuous Galerkin Time Domain (DGTD) methods, supporting high-order elements.

tools.name: HORSES3D
tools.one_line_profile: High-order discontinuous Galerkin solver for flow simulations
tools.detailed_description: A high-order discontinuous Galerkin solver designed for flow simulations and multi-physics applications, emphasizing spectral element methods.

tools.name: IGA-dealii
tools.one_line_profile: Isogeometric Analysis extension for the deal.II library
tools.detailed_description: A library extending deal.II with Isogeometric Analysis (IGA) capabilities, developed by the SISSA mathLab.

tools.name: ITHACA-SEM
tools.one_line_profile: Reduced Order Modeling library for Spectral Element Methods
tools.detailed_description: A library for Real Time Highly Advanced Computational Applications using Spectral Element Methods, focusing on Reduced Order Modeling (ROM).

tools.name: deal2lkit
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit library for deal.II finite element library
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit library providing additional functionality and utilities for the deal.II finite element library, developed by SISSA mathLab.

tools.name: pi-DoMUS
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel Deal.II Multiphysics Solver
tools.detailed_description: A parallel multiphysics solver built on top of the deal.II library, designed for complex coupled simulations.

tools.name: PyMFEM
tools.one_line_profile: Python wrapper for the MFEM finite element library
tools.detailed_description: A Python wrapper for MFEM, enabling high-performance finite element simulations and rapid prototyping in Python.

tools.name: MFEM
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable C++ library for finite element methods
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight, general, and scalable C++ library for finite element methods, supporting high-order finite elements and a wide variety of solvers.

tools.name: Chebyshev
tools.one_line_profile: Python module for Chebyshev polynomial approximation
tools.detailed_description: A Python module for approximating SymPy expressions using Taylor series and Chebyshev polynomials, useful for numerical analysis and spectral methods.

tools.name: mpopt
tools.one_line_profile: Pseudo-spectral collocation based multi-phase optimal control solver
tools.detailed_description: A solver for multi-phase optimal control problems using pseudo-spectral collocation methods.

tools.name: scPrisma
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral analysis method for single-cell pseudotime reconstruction
tools.detailed_description: A spectral analysis method for pseudotime reconstruction, inference, and filtering of cyclic signals in single-cell data.

tools.name: ChiDG
tools.one_line_profile: Chimera-based Discontinuous Galerkin solver
tools.detailed_description: A Discontinuous Galerkin (DG) solver utilizing Chimera (overset) grids for flexible mesh handling in simulations.

tools.name: openPSTD
tools.one_line_profile: Visual interface and solver for Pseudo-Spectral Time-Domain method in acoustics
tools.detailed_description: An open-source platform providing a visual interface and solver for the Pseudo-Spectral Time-Domain (PSTD) method to simulate sound propagation.

tools.name: libparanumal
tools.one_line_profile: Accelerated high-order finite element flow solvers
tools.detailed_description: A library of high-performance, GPU-accelerated finite element flow solvers and benchmarks, focusing on high-order methods.

tools.name: ppkMHD
tools.one_line_profile: MPI+Kokkos implementation of spectral difference method for MHD
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) solver implementing spectral difference method (SDM) high order schemes, utilizing MPI and Kokkos for parallel execution.

tools.name: DGFEM-Acoustic
tools.one_line_profile: Discontinuous Galerkin FEM solver for Acoustic Wave Propagation
tools.detailed_description: A C++ implementation of the Discontinuous Galerkin Finite Element Method (DGFEM) specifically designed for simulating acoustic wave propagation.

tools.name: precice-dealii-adapter
tools.one_line_profile: Coupling adapter for deal.II within the preCICE ecosystem
tools.detailed_description: An adapter allowing the coupling of structural solvers written with the finite element library deal.II to other solvers via the preCICE coupling library.

tools.name: pychebfun
tools.one_line_profile: Python implementation of Chebfun for computing with functions
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing the Chebfun system, allowing for numerical computing with functions using Chebyshev polynomial expansions.

tools.name: pymor-deal.II
tools.one_line_profile: Bindings for deal.II to use with pyMOR
tools.detailed_description: Provides bindings to interface the deal.II finite element library with pyMOR, enabling model order reduction for deal.II based models. (Included due to institutional backing by pyMOR)

tools.name: TorchFSM
tools.one_line_profile: Fourier Spectral Method implementation with PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A library implementing Fourier Spectral Methods using PyTorch, enabling differentiable spectral simulations and integration with deep learning workflows.

tools.name: PolynomialBases.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Polynomial bases for spectral element methods in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library providing efficient implementations of polynomial bases used in spectral element methods, serving as a foundational component for high-order solvers.

tools.name: SummationByPartsOperators.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Summation-by-parts (SBP) operators for stable discretizations
tools.detailed_description: A Julia library of summation-by-parts (SBP) operators used in finite difference, Fourier pseudospectral, and Galerkin methods to ensure provably stable semidiscretizations.

tools.name: PostMesh
tools.one_line_profile: Curvilinear mesh generator for high order finite element analysis
tools.detailed_description: A library for generating high-order curvilinear meshes, essential for high-order finite element and spectral element analysis.

tools.name: DGTile
tools.one_line_profile: Discontinuous Galerkin adaptive mesh library
tools.detailed_description: A portably performant discontinuous Galerkin adaptive mesh library developed by Sandia National Laboratories. (Included due to institutional backing)

tools.name: Jexpresso
tools.one_line_profile: Numerical solution of conservation laws using spectral elements
tools.detailed_description: Research software for solving conservation laws using spectral element methods, capable of running on CPUs and GPUs.

tools.name: snek5000
tools.one_line_profile: Python framework for Nek5000
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework for Nek5000, a high-fidelity spectral element code for fluid dynamics, facilitating simulation setup and execution.

tools.name: shenfun
tools.one_line_profile: High performance spectral Galerkin platform in Python
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance computational platform in Python for solving partial differential equations using the spectral Galerkin method.

tools.name: spectralDNS
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral Navier-Stokes solvers in Python
tools.detailed_description: A suite of spectral solvers for the Navier-Stokes equations and related systems, implemented in Python.

tools.name: mfem-mgis
tools.one_line_profile: Coupling interface between MFEM and MGIS
tools.detailed_description: A coupling tool that connects the MFEM finite element library with MGIS (MFront Generic Interface Support) for advanced material modelling. (Included due to institutional backing by MFront/EDF ecosystem)

tools.name: FastAST
tools.one_line_profile: Fast primal-dual interior point method for line spectral estimation
tools.detailed_description: A MATLAB implementation of a fast primal-dual interior point method for line spectral estimation via atomic norm soft thresholding.

tools.name: Latent-Spectral-Models
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning model for solving high-dimensional PDEs using latent spectral representations
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of Latent Spectral Models (LSM) for solving high-dimensional partial differential equations. It leverages spectral methods within a latent space to approximate PDE solutions efficiently, as presented at ICML 2023.

tools.name: SpectralKit.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia library for spectral method building blocks
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package providing essential components for implementing spectral methods, including basis functions, transforms, and grid utilities, designed to facilitate the construction of spectral solvers.

tools.name: Trixi.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive high-order numerical simulation framework for conservation laws
tools.detailed_description: A numerical simulation framework in Julia for hyperbolic conservation laws. It supports adaptive mesh refinement and high-order methods, including Discontinuous Galerkin (DG), making it suitable for fluid dynamics and other physics simulations.

tools.name: drdg3d
tools.one_line_profile: 3D dynamic rupture modeling using Discontinuous Galerkin method
tools.detailed_description: A Fortran-based Discontinuous Galerkin Finite Element code specifically designed for 3D dynamic rupture modeling in seismology, enabling high-fidelity simulation of earthquake source physics.

tools.name: DGseisfor3D
tools.one_line_profile: 3D seismic wave simulation based on Discontinuous Galerkin Method
tools.detailed_description: A simulation tool for modeling 3D seismic wave propagation using the Discontinuous Galerkin method, suitable for geophysics and seismological research.

tools.name: python-modularity-maximization
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral method implementation for network modularity maximization
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing Newman's spectral method for maximizing modularity in network analysis. It is used for community detection and graph clustering tasks in scientific data analysis.
